sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with non-square matrices
message_1:
Here's a precise numerical problem for solving systems of linear equations with non-square matrices:

Solve the system of equations:

3x + 2y + z = 1 

2x - y + 4z = 2 

x + 3y - 2z = -1 

using the matrix method.
message_2:
To solve the given system of linear equations using the matrix method, we will first represent the system as a matrix equation AX = B, where A is the coefficient matrix, X is the column matrix of variables, and B is the column matrix of constants.

The given system of equations can be written as:

[3  2  1] [x]   [ 1]
[2 -1  4] [y] = [ 2]
[1  3 -2] [z]   [-1]

Now, we have the matrix equation AX = B, where:

A = | 3  2  1 |
    | 2 -1  4 |
    | 1  3 -2 |

X = | x |
    | y |
    | z |

B = |  1  |
    |  2  |
    | -1  |

To find the solution, we will first find the inverse of matrix A, denoted as A^(-1). Then, we will multiply both sides of the equation by A^(-1) to get X = A^(-1)B.

Step 1: Find the determinant of matrix A.

det(A) = 3(-1(-2) - 4(3)) - 2(2(-2) - 4(1)) + 1(2(3) - (-1)(1))
       = 3(2 + 12) - 2(-4 + 4) + 1(6 + 1)
       = 3(14) - 2(0) + 7
       = 42 + 7
       = 49

Since det(A) â‰  0, the inverse of matrix A exists.

Step 2: Find the adjugate of matrix A and divide it by the determinant to get A^(-1).

adj(A) = | (-1)(-2) - 4(3)  (2)(-2) - 4(1)  (2)(3) - (-1)(1) |
         | (1)(-2) - 3(3)   (3)(-2) - 1(1)  (3)(3) - 1(1)    |
         | (1)(4) - 3(-1)   (3)(4) - 2(1)   (3)(2) - 2(-1)   |

adj(A) = | -10  -4  7  |
         | -11   5  8  |
         |  7   10  7  |

A^(-1) = (1/det(A)) * adj(A)

A^(-1) = (1/49) * | -10  -4  7  |
                 | -11   5  8  |
                 |  7   10  7  |

Step 3: Multiply A^(-1) by B to get the solution matrix X.

X = A^(-1)B = (1/49) * | -10  -4  7  | * |  1  |
                        | -11   5  8  |   |  2  |
                        |  7   10  7  |   | -1  |

X = (1/49) * | -10(1) - 4(2) + 7(-1) |
             | -11(1) + 5(2) + 8(-1) |
             |  7(1) + 10(2) + 7(-1) |

X = (1/49) * | -18 |
             |   1 |
             |  20 |

X = | -18/49 |
    |   1/49 |
    |  20/49 |

So, the solution to the given system of linear equations is x = -18/49, y = 1/49, and z = 20/49.
